channel.title: Amazing Women... brains, beauty & style
channel.itunes:subtitle: A show about Amazing Women
channel.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
channel.itunes:summary: What it comes down to it ladies, it's that defining line between "been there - done that!" Dr Marlene’s been there and done plenty! Now she joins the expanding medium of radio. She hosts Amazing Women…brains, beauty and style where she highlights truly amazing women of all ages…the real stars. Now she leads you on an exploration of Amazing Women. With her outrageous style and quick wit Dr Marlene , speaker, author, award winning inventor …welcomes all ages to spend an incredible hour and a discovery that Amazing Women aren’t born, they’re made…to make history!

item.title: Show 143 The Dog Expert Launches her Book: Leashes and Lovers
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 143 The Dog Expert Launches her Book: Leashes and Lovers
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Sheryl Matthys is The Dog Expert, a certified dog trainer with a psychology degree and a master’s in Radio/TV. Today she launches: Leashes and Lovers, the Book. Her new book named after her dog lovers social community where she unleashes the secrets to a better life: including how to launch a new relationship and how to strengthen relationships with family and friends. She knows your dog is a living radar with finely tuned senses and they can help you when choosing the right people or even that someone special in your life.
Join Dr Marlene and Sheryl on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern on VoiceAmerica and World Talk Radio or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask a question. Find us at: http://awbbsshow.com or http://drmarlenebbs.com for shows archives; http://insideawbbs.com. Stay beautiful with my skin care line http://ssskincare.com

item.title: Show 142 Crazy Aunt Purl Live with Her Cats
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 142 Crazy Aunt Purl Live with Her Cats
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Laurie Perry is the author of Home Is Where the Wine Is and Drunk, Divorced and Covered In Cat Hair. She is best known at CrazyAuntPurl.com, her online diary. It's a peek into the daily life of a woman who is trying to figure it all out, whatever "it" may be, with a fine assortment of wines, cats and post-divorce home improvement projects. She loves knitting, although she admits she isn't an expert; although she is a big fan of the rectangle. She says it is very liberating to make a scarf. She is a hoot to talk to and fits her web presents.

item.title: Show 141 Fitness - Nutrition Writer
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 141 Fitness - Nutrition Writer
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Linda Melone is an award-winning writer and fitness professional and certified personal trainer with a degree in foods and nutrition. Based in California, she writes regularly for a variety of national print and online publications. Her byline appears in the March 2010 issue of Better Homes and Gardens, a great article titled "The $50 Gym; she writes a regular column, "Easy Does It" for Oxygen magazine and a fitness column, "Crosstraining," for Women's Running magazine. Her work has also appeared in Glamour, SELF, Family Circle, Arthritis Today, AARP The Magazine and numerous other magazines.

item.itunes:subtitle: Show 139 The Masterful Business Trainer with the Sword
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Ann Evanston trains people worldwide techniques of the warrior. She is part educator with a Masters in Psychology/Training and part Zena the Warrior with a sword and very little princess! She has over 20 years of speaking and consulting with extensive training development of new leaders from corporate America. She is a master in web 2.0 or social networking arena. She is a master at reinvention: from her own sorority to a non-profit for homeless pregnant teens while in college, to speaker to large corporations to now new programs for entrepreneurs and small business owners. The Lady with the Sword and after talking with Ann you forget sometimes and call her Zena!

item.title: Show 138 A Siren of Chrome and Business
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 138 A Siren of Chrome and Business
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Margery Krevsky is an award winning author and the owner and CEO of the largest talent agency in the mid-west: Productions Plus –The Talent Shop. Started in 1981 Productions Plus provides talent for auto and trade shows in fact anywhere talent is needed in the auto industry. She is the person behind changing the role of models in the auto industry. In 2009 she acquired a second company making Production Plus – The Talent Shop the largest talent agency in Michigan and one of the largest in the nation; expanding the company into the burgeoning Michigan film industry. She is the author of Sirens of Chrome a coffee-table book on the history of car shows and models. She’s the force behind a new line of cosmetics created especially for show models but is now sold exclusive in salons nationwide. We have got to ask what’s next!
Join Dr Marlene and Margery on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern on VoiceAmerica and World Talk Radio or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask a question. Find us at: http://awbbsshow.com or http://drmarlenebbs.com for shows archives; http://insideawbbs.com. Stay beautiful with my skin care line http://ssskincare.com

item.title: Show 137 Widows Wear Stilettos
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 137 Widows Wear Stilettos
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Carol Brody Fleet is an award-winning author of "Widows Wear Stilettos, a speaker and more important a coach to those who have been touched by the pain and challenge of loss of any kind. She is the founder of Widows Wear Stilettos and her very popular website, WidowsWearStilettos.com, the first website of its kind; allowing the widowed of any age to interact with each other and find support and encouragement; helpful tips, education and resources for themselves and for their children. The site is where: not only do you learn to understand the healing process but also beauty, fashion and even when you are ready dating tips...with the ability to interact with others that understand. Carol also uses her own experiences as an author and writer to educate and motivate those who aspire to a career in writing as an instructor for The Learning Annex.
Join Dr Marlene and Carol on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask your question. Adjust for your zone on VoiceAmerica and World Talk Radio. Visit our websites: http://awbbsshow.com or http://drmarlenebbs.com for previous shows archives; http://insideawbbs.com http://ssskincare.com

item.title: Show 136 Hollywood Screenwriter, Novelist, Creative Seeker
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 136 Hollywood Screenwriter, Novelist, Creative Seeker
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Jessica Bendinger is Hollywood screenwriter who launched onto the scene with her original script for the hit hip hop cheerleading comedy, Bring it On. A former journalist for Spin Magazine and MTV News, she covered the hip-hop movement while at Columbia University. She wrote and directed the hit comedy Stick It, starring Jeff Bridges and Missy Peregrym. Stick It was the #1 movie download on iTunes for 7 weeks in a row, during the film’s home video release. A former model who worked for Stephen Sprouse, she appeared on the runway in “Slaves of New York,” Jessica was named by Glamour Magazine as one of Hollywood’s “Most Powerful Women Under 40”. She is currently writing her next feature film and working on the sequel to The Seven Rays.
Join Dr Marlene and Jessica on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask your question. Adjust for your zone on VoiceAmerica and World Talk Radio. Visit our websites: http://awbbsshow.com or http://drmarlenebbs.com for previous shows archives http://insideawbbs.com http://ssskincare.com

item.title: Show 135 Caring for Parents with Elder Rage
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 135 Caring for Parents with Elder Rage
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Jacqueline Marcell was so compelled by caring for her elderly parents (both with early Alzheimer’s which went undiagnosed for over a year) that once she figured everything out she gave up a career as a television executive to become an advocate for eldercare awareness and reform. She is a devoted daughter in her bestselling book, Elder Rage. Many endorsements including: John Hopkins Memory Clinic and the National Adult Day Services Association honored her with their Media Award. She received “Advocate of the year” from the National Association of Women Business Owners at their Remarkable Women Awards. She advocates that everyone, especially caregivers, monitor their own health for in the midst of this she became a breast cancer survivor. As an international speaker she is a regular on TV and has been featured on the cover of AARP.
Join Dr Marlene and Jacqueline on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask your question. Adjust for your zone on VoiceAmerica and World Talk Radio. Visit our websites: http://awbbsshow.com or http://drmarlenebbs.com for previous shows archives http://insideawbbs.com http://ssskincare.com

item.title: Show 134 Down That Aisle in Style
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 134 Down That Aisle in Style
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Chamein Canton knew at the startling age of 4 her life’s passion was planning weddings. With her fiery independence from her father and her sweet charm of a Southern Belle from her mother she was determined to have the career of her dreams. Life threw in a few extra curves for her: twin boys, divorce, uterine cancer and MS. But she persisted by becoming an author (7 books) and continuing to work to her dream of being a wedding consultant. As she puts it because of genetics she decided to focus on full figured brides and the treatment they receive when their day of days is about to happen. As a former plus size bride I knew what she meant. In 2002 she became MS Mother of the Year.
Join Dr Marlene and Chamein on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask your question. Adjust for your zone on VoiceAmerica and World Talk Radio. Visit our websites: http://awbbsshow.com or http://drmarlenebbs.com for previous shows archives http://insideawbbs.com http://ssskincare.com

item.title: Show 133 Huge Sci-Fi Following for a Gifted Actress
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 133 Huge Sci-Fi Following for a Gifted Actress
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Ellen Dubin is a Gemini Award nominated actress for her series regular role Jeri Slate in the Leo Award winning supernatural drama The Collector. Where she really stands out is she is a cult figure in the Sci-fi world for playing the alien cannibal Giggerota the Wicked in the international cult hit Lexx. She spent all four seasons on Lexx as four different characters…including the first Pope in Sci-fi history. Her affinity for the unusual has lead her to starring roles in The Dead Zone, Blood Ties, Mutant X, A Wrinkle in Time, The Highlander and The Raven. She is the go-to-girl for movies from the Sci-Fi and Lifetime Networks. Recently she stepped away from sci-fi to film the Hallmark Hall Of Fame Presentation/CBS movie of the week The Lois Wilson story opposite Winona Ryder.
Join Dr Marlene and Ellen on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask your question. Adjust for your zone on VoiceAmerica and World Talk Radio. Visit our websites: http://awbbsshow.com or http://drmarlenebbs.com for previous shows archives http://insideawbbs.com

item.itunes:subtitle: Show 132 Passion for Poker, Business and Life
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Donna Blevins, Poker Strategy Coach and a true entrepreneur with careers in modeling, acting, marketing, advertising, real estate, professional speaking, training, journalism, and gaming. When she became a poker journalist she also began competing in poker tournaments. She got the nickname of Poker Amazon as she stands a whopping 6’5” (1.95 meters) This prompted her expansion of her regular programs to include poker as a self-development tool. As a poker strategy coach not only does she teach how to compete in the card draw of poker but also the strategy to win in one of the most grueling parts the mind set game of poker. Donna is offering our audience a free poker teleseminar class. Go to: http://www.pokerforthebeginner.com to find out more.

item.title: Show 131 Pearls of Wisdom from Dr Sandy V
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 131 Pearls of Wisdom from Dr Sandy V
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Dr. Sandy Venditti, author of Pearls of Wisdom and a practicing dentist for over 14 years saw beyond the gums and teeth of her patients. She witnessed the pain; the fear and confusion behind their eyes. She knew many of them didn’t need to be in her chair; that what she was treating was easily preventable. Dr. Sandy V. has treated patients of all ages and nationalities, and found the same problems, the same fears. And, she knew she had the wisdom to prevent it. Dr. Sandy V is not your typical dentist. This multi-faceted, Italian-speaking businesswoman has a second passion – in the financial industry. She is accredited with the Canadian Securities and also holds an MBA. She speaks candidly about the financial costs of not maintaining oral health and how insurance coverage often influences dental visits and treatment options.
Join Dr Marlene and Dr Sandy V on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask your question. item.title: Show 128 Julie Continues Zig’s Timeless Message
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 128 Julie Continues Zig’s Timeless Message
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Julie Ziglar Norman became her father’s editor as a result of having won a place at the biannual Writer’s Workshop that Guideposts magazine hosts to develop new talent. Fifteen years and twenty-one books later Julie and Zig are still writing away. In 2007 after Zig fell down the stairway in his home and suffered a head injury resulting in short-term memory loss, it became apparent that an interview format was necessary to help Zig continue to help others get what they want out of life. Julie was determined to be the best choice as interviewer because or her intimate knowledge of Zig’s material. Julie and Zig’s dynamic on stage relationship has inspired over a hundred thousand people in audiences all across America.
Join Dr Marlene with Julie on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask your question. item.title: Show 123 Origins of the Red Hot Mama
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 123 Origins of the Red Hot Mama
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Susan Ecker is the number one part of a dynamic duo that is an expert on the great comedienne Sophie Tucker (1884-1966) known as “The Last of the Red Hot Mamas”. After doing a show while in college with a ‘new singer’ named Bette Midler and being introduced to her “Soph Jokes” she became lifelong Sophie Tucker and Bette Midler fans. Currently working on a book and a documentary about Sophie Tucker’s life Susan has become one of the foremost authorities on Sophie Tucker’s Life (her husband being the other authority). Sophie Tucker was bigger than life; and Susan knows all the great stories. This is going to be a hoot of a show and one you will want to tell your friends about.
Join Dr Marlene with Susan on Wednesday at 2:00PM Pacific Time; 4:00PM Central; 5:00PM Eastern or call us at 866-472-5788 to ask your question. item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Caroline Sutherland has a vast clinical background as an allergy-testing technician in environmental medicine, where her intuitive gift developed. She was raised in a medical family: Her mother a dietician, and her father and grandfather were medical doctors. As a child, her family lineage created important seeds for her future career as a medical intuitive. For the past 23 years, she has lectured internationally on the subject, and her intuitive impressions have positively affected the lives of many people. Elizabeth Pratt knows firsthand what it is like to be told you need a heart transplant. But when she started her journey information to help her through the ordeal was almost nonexistent. Information for the patients, receiving the life giving organs and information for the donor family of the Angels; her book, Dancing with Angels does all of that and more. item.title: Show 115 Behind the Scenes and Off the Record
item.itunes:subtitle: Show 115 Behind the Scenes and Off the Record
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary:
Elizabeth Sanchez is the host and consultant of the award winning national PBS series A Place of Our Own. A Place of Our Own is an educational and innovative program nominated for a day time Emmy Award in its’ fifth season. She is a multi Regional Emmy Award winning Journalist and a 17 year Veteran Reporter. item.title: Show 66 World Travel with Delicious Baby
item.itunes:subtitle: World Travel with Delicious Baby
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Debbie Dubrow and her husband like to travel with their two children. Having traveled extensively before having children from Europe to Africa to the Middle East and all through the US they knew they didn’t want to leave their kids with grandparents during trips or hire a childcare person to watch them. item.itunes:subtitle: From Media News Executive to Howdini Founder
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Shelley Lewis is an author, co-founder of the website Howdini.com, a wife, a mother and a daughter. She began her second career as a writer and website owner and she's never regretted it for a minute, except at certain times when she misses that large salary she use to earn as a network executive. But she doesn’t miss the work. Shelley spent the first 25 years of her career in mainstream media as a producer and executive producer of news programs for NBC, ABC, and CNN. She was also a co-creator of Air America Radio, and served as vice president of programming for two years. She has her new book: 5 lessons I didn’t learn from breast cancer and the big one I did; a modern girl’s guide to breast cancer (she hates the word survivor), her ‘Tumor Sniffing’ Dog, Chester, and her new website Howdini! We will talk about it all.

item.title: Show 63 Christmas from the Cole Family and Hilda
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas from the Cole Family and Hilda
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Jennifer Liu Bryan and Hazel Cole Kendle are the new Cole Family storytellers. As Hazel remembers their family’s storyteller was, Ruble, who passed down to her the tale of a very special family Christmas that took place when Hazel’s father was working as a coal miner and the family was living in the small town of Benham, Kentucky. She often wished that she had paid more attention when her parents told stories of their upbringing in the mountains of Appalachia, or when her brothers and sisters spun tales of their childhood adventures. Now, as the last of the nine children in the family, she shares as much as she can of those family tales with new generations of the Cole family, a time to remember of home, hearth and family; a special granddaughter, grandmother project to share with your family.

item.title: Show 61 Most Non-Profits Work Hard!
item.itunes:subtitle: Most Non-Profits Work Hard!
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Colleen Mensel is the Executive Director of a non-profit in Southern California. She didn’t start out thinking of working for a non-profit. She started with a passion for horses and the outdoors, she wanted to show horses and become an Equine Veterinarian (horse doctor). She purchased her first untamed horse, as a teen after saving quarters for three and a half years. When a medical condition brought an end to her dream she looked to another passion preserving history. She is the person behind the Centennial Heritage Museum in Orange County California; a museum that educates students and visitors in the history and heritage of the county and the country. She is working to make the museum an educational step back in time for all who visit…and they have a complete blacksmiths barn where her love of horses still gets to shine.

item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Edna Sahm is a slice of American history and the progression of society. She started out poor as a under-privileged and orphaned child. She is affectionately known as the Queen of Escondido, California. Edna takes to philanthropy with the heart of a wife, mother, friend and humanitarian to enhance mankind: supporting the Arts, Women’s Shelters, and Interfaith Hospice. Edna will tell you she has been rich and poor…She likes to joke rich is better. Born March 6, 1917 you also might say that Edna is a walking history book. This will truly be an inspirational Amazing Women show…please don’t miss it.

item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Esther Gokhale can get you back to a pain free back. After getting crippling back pain during her first pregnancy and having unsuccessful surgery Esther has had a lifelong crusade to vanquish back pain. With studies at Harvard and Princeton and learning acupuncture at the San Francisco School of Oriental Medicine then studies in Paris, research in Brazil, India, Portugal and many more around the world led to her development of the Gokhale Method and her systematic approach to help people live pain free. She found that instead of being complicated the answer was more basic. Esther’s incredible new book 8 Steps to a Pain Free Back shows you in beautiful color photos all the ways to live pain free. Her book is working for me after becoming one of the millions with back pain. If you know anyone who has back pain send them this e-card and get them to listen to this show.

item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Nadine Godwin is the editor at large of Travel Weekly, based in New York. She joined Travel Weekly in 1972 as a reporter and became editor in chief of the then-twice-weekly newspaper 1997. She has been a contributing freelance travel journalist to numerous consumer newspapers around the country. She was named the Travel Journalist of the Year by the American Society of Travel Agents. Travel Weekly is a weekly trade closed-circulation publication for travel agents. Nadine is the one to talk to when it comes to travel. She keeps the agents informed so they can make our arrangements perfect. A travelers, traveler…you might say.

item.title: Show 49 Shoe-ology from a City Girls Philosophy
item.itunes:subtitle: Shoe-ology from a City Girls Philosophy
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Karn Knutson’s first artistic endeavor was on the living room walls at the age of two. To this day her family swears her first words were sarcasm. A perfect combination of talents to land her as a Creative director at an advertising agency, but in 2004 she left her ‘day job’ and those oh so chilly winters of Minneapolis to pursue her dreams. Karn then sashayed off to San Francisco in her favorite pair of strappy sandals where she now makes art, writes books, dodges crazy drivers on her scooter, hangs out in coffee shops studying people their shoes and hopes to share something joyful with the world. You may have seen her point of view art at Franklin Covey in a day timer or heard her wit talking about shoes on television. I wouldn’t be surprised if we see her in the future on comedy central. If you enjoy shoes and laughter this is a show for you!

item.title: Show 46 Life’s too Short to be a Troll!
item.itunes:subtitle: Life’s too Short to be a Troll!
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Minna, at 17, wanted to be a singer but was convinced by her parents that a “safe” job was better for her. She had an illustrious career that looked fabulously to all around her but inside she was miserable in her successful career. She was killing her own unique spirit…her Pixie. While recovering from a horrific burn accident she discovered that she was living as a troll and needed to release the Pixie in her. She set about to do just that she got on track for her Pixification. She founded the Pixie Revolution which is about freeing and being your unique self and knowing that you are beautiful no matter what. Hear her story and learn from Minna; life is more fun when you release your Pixie.

item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Alexis Martin Neely is revolutionizing the world of financial and estate planning for families and the way Americans think about lawyers as the Personal Family Lawyer you love. item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Anne Snowden Crosman, is an award-winning author of Young At Heart: Aging Gracefully With Attitude; celebrity interviews on how to stay positive, productive, and joyful as we age. At 28, Anne was the first woman hired by CBS Radio Network to do full-time newscasts. She has continued to blaze a path for women in the fields of radio news, social activism, and education. She worked here and abroad as a NBC Radio Network News Correspondent, and freelanced for The Washington Post, Newsweek, The Christian Science Monitor, Dossier Magazine, Monitor Radio, and Voice of America. Two years ago, she left New York and Washington, D.C.to live in Sedona, Arizona, where she is working on her next book. She teaches memoir-writing, yoga, and aerobics at the Osher Lifelong Learning Institute. A boomer you need to hear.

item.title: Show 43 Where Babies Come from Watermelons
item.itunes:subtitle: Where Babies Come from Watermelons
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Laura Wellington looked at what was missing in children’s television and decided to give moms what they wanted…family friendly television that really teaches core values from responsibility, friendship and respect. She used her artistic talents as a way of escaping her sadness. She invented the Wumblers; her multi-colored, multi-cultured cartoon characters that bring family friendly values and positive messages for children that entertain and teach with each episode. The Wumblers are bulbous-shaped characters whose food falls from the sky, whose babies come from watermelons, and whose stories blend inspiration, imagination, fun, spiritually and globally conscious all wrapped around a family centric message and upbeat music. Laura is at the core of this whirl wind and her story will inspire you.

item.title: Show 32 From the Brink of Death to the Matterhorn
item.itunes:subtitle: From the Brink of Death to the Matterhorn
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Kelly Perkins discovered at age 30, she needed a heart transplant. For an active person, she thought her lifestyle was over. But with the support of a loving husband, Kelly, given at one point a week to live, becoming the first heart transplant recipient to climb some of the world’s most recognized peaks. Mountains, most of us in perfect health, would never think of attempting to climb! Kelly has brought worldwide attention to organ donation. Her story shows what the human body and spirit are truly capable of achieving. She has hits peaks and valleys in her climbs and in her life; now hear how she has overcome it all. A great story for this time or anytime of the year.

Director of BoomerGirl Multimedia for the World Company: editor of BoomerGirl.com, and a weekly column in the Lawrence Journal-World. She says she writes on subjects she knows you-know like: sex, dieting, girlfriends, guerilla parenting and being dysfunction. If you are a boomer woman, if you are starting to get those hot flashes, if you are a parent of a boomerang kid, you will find Cathy’s look irresistible and impossible not to laugh. This is a must listen show to start off the Creation of Our Best Year Ever!

item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Becky Robbins could be your neighbor or fellow worker at any company. She is an ordinary woman that went through want many people go through daily. item.title: Show 16 Take Our Kids Back!
item.itunes:subtitle: Take Our Kids Back!
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Aimee Breen and her young family are leaders of a revolt. A revolt against: feeding our nations children the cheapest nutritional deficient and chemically laden food in our country. She was frustrated at the choices available for her family, thus she and her business partner formed a company called Green Kidz. Their philosophy is from seed to shelf. With their model, Green Kidz will be able to supply the freshest and highest quality food for each community, to homes, schools and retail chains. Aimee will tell us how stepping back from the huge multi-product conglomerate that also manufactures food… to the more regional friendly, family farmer will help kidz stay healthy and happy for life. She honed her managing skills in San Francisco restaurants like Kuleto’s, Maya, and Oritalia; and her start up skills at the Sunrise Coffee Company. Aimee is developing a core group of mothers who are the champions of Green Kidz, motivated to getting nutritious food into schools and homes.

She honed her managing skills in San Francisco restaurants like Kuleto’s, Maya, and Oritalia; and her start up skills at the Sunrise Coffee Company. Aimee is developing a core group of mothers who are the champions of Green Kidz, motivated to getting nutritious food into schools and homes.
item.itunes:keywords: Aimee Breen, Kids, food, mothers, schools, marketing, interview, Positive Talk, psychology, producer, author, book, Dr Marlene, Dr Marlene Siersema

item.title: Show 15 Wild Women Throw an Amazing Party!!
item.itunes:subtitle: Wild Women Throw an Amazing Party!!
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: What do you need for an amazing party? My favorite answer would be an amazing and wild woman with culinary talents with an extra twist on pastries. Lynette Shirk is the author of six books and was the Pastry Chef at Williams-Sonoma’s corporate headquarters in San Francisco. Actually her start into culinary history was making pizza in the mid-west. A graduate of Ohio State University, she moved to San Francisco to attend California Culinary Academy, where she cooked scallops with Julia Child. Lynette’s books and 1300 recipes have been featured on QVC and in Family Circle magazine. Making her presence known in the San Francisco Bay area she worked for restaurants from Bizou to the Hornblower Dining Yachts. During that time she invented Java Lava and actually went to work for Spinelli Coffee Company to understand coffee better. Volcano Candy became a hit and she developed several flavors. Expect this to be a wild and calorie laden show. Don’t Miss it!

item.title: Show 14 Breaking the Glass Ceiling…Without Getting Hurt!
item.itunes:subtitle: Breaking the Glass Ceiling…Without Getting Hurt!
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Is there a glass ceiling in your organization? Do you want to be the person that can shatter that glass without getting hurt? Diane Dutton can be just that person who can help put you on the road to the executive suite. Diane is the author of the new book “A Woman's Ladder To Success Is Paved With Broken Glass Ceilings”. She has 26 years experience of being a CPA, CEO and CFO as a Financial Strategy Corporate Executive and Business Coach. item.title: Show 12 New Country with Great Success!
item.itunes:subtitle: New Country with Great Success!
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: She has a multinational entrepreneurial history. Holding two masters’ degrees in economics and education prepared Silvia Schuessler for all of the success she had. As Executive Manager of direct sales; she was an expert in implementation of strategies resulting in exceptional performance and outstanding company growth. She was the General Manager of SM-Handelsgesellschaft m.b.H. –Munich, Germany where she managed the wholesale import of a product with millions in sales each year. Then she moved to the United States, where language was a problem and customs were different. What did this multinational entrepreneur do? She dug in learning the U.S ways quickly and has become an award winning entrepreneur. Silvia has also added acting to her varied background with many films and commercials to her credit. Her love for her new country can only be outshined by her smile.

item.title: Show 11 10 Lessons to Having Your work your Way
item.itunes:subtitle: 10 Lessons to Having Your work your Way
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Starting out as a minimum wage employee, with a degree from Stanford and a masters from the University of Michigan, Nan Russell, hit her stride 5 years ago as a Vice-President of a $4.4 Billion dollar company and moved to what is left of the wild and wooly west of Grizzly bears and mountain lions of northwestern Montana. Nan and her husband had a plan from the beginning to nibble their way up the ladder of success right to the cabin in Montana. What were her passions that lead to the wide open spaces? Most of us have dreams and aspirations, but few people actualize them or live their life’s potential. Currently living her life dream Nan shares perspectives on how to you can invent the future that you want to face. Learn the 10 lessons to having your work your way. Nan’s philosophy is that when we are all winning (offering the best of who we are at a soul-level to the world) then we will all win.

item.title: Show 6 Leading from the Front
item.itunes:subtitle: Leading from the Front
item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Leadership skills are rarely taught in schools or on the job, yet they are necessary skills that help women find personal and professional success. There are many misconceptions about what it takes to be a leader. Leadership isn’t about power, prestige, position or job title. Being a leader is about influencing outcomes and inspiring others – as women we do this every day. Every woman is a leader in some aspect of her life, yet many women haven’t considered themselves leaders often apologizing for leadership roles in corporations. Teaching women leadership skills learned from their time as Marines is Angie Morgan and Courtney Lynch goal. Learn skills that can be applied immediately directly from the Marines with a twist just for women.

item.title: Show 1 Amazing Parenting Traits Equals Business Knowhow

item.itunes:author: Dr Marlene Siersema
item.itunes:summary: Having an amazing business, as a mom, with one or more children in the house can be a mind numbing goal.
